articles.headline: Dubai Faces Environmental Problems After Growth
articles.snippet: The emirate offers a cautionary tale in the pitfalls of constructing metropolises in the parched desert.
articles.abstract: The emirate offers a cautionary tale in the pitfalls of constructing metropolises in the parched desert.
articles.lead_paragraph: DUBAI  Dubai’s skyline is the most sparkling in the Middle East. But down on the ground, the environmental problems of a quickly erected city built on sand look a lot less alluring.

articles.headline: Airline Unions Seek a Share of the Industry Gains
articles.snippet: Labor talks with the newly merged United and Continental Airlines could serve as a bellwether for the industry.
articles.abstract: Labor talks with the newly merged United and Continental Airlines could serve as a bellwether for the industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: The glamour of working for an airline long ago lost its luster.

articles.headline: A Phone of Promise, With Flaws
articles.snippet: Windows Phone 7 is new phone software that Microsoft hopes will run on new phones from various manufacturers and cellular networks.
articles.abstract: Windows Phone 7 is new phone software that Microsoft hopes will run on new phones from various manufacturers and cellular networks.
articles.lead_paragraph: What on earth is Microsoft doing, bringing out its iPhone competitor now, in 2010?

articles.headline: Obama Coalition Is Fraying, Poll Finds
articles.snippet: Key parts of the Democratic coalition — women, Catholics, independents and the poor — are switching sides, according to the latest Times/CBS News poll.
articles.abstract: Key parts of the Democratic coalition — women, Catholics, independents and the poor — are switching sides, according to the latest Times/CBS News poll.
articles.lead_paragraph: Critical parts of the coalition that delivered President Obama to the White House in 2008 and gave Democrats control of Congress in 2006 are switching their allegiance to the Republicans in the final phase of the midterm Congressional elections, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Megan Thee-Brenan

articles.headline: Homeowners Facing Foreclosure Demand Recourse
articles.snippet: Many homeowners say they were victims of bank errors in a system where “no one double-checks anything.”
articles.abstract: Many homeowners say they were victims of bank errors in a system where “no one double-checks anything.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Ricky Rought paid cash to the Deutsche Bank National Trust Company for a four-room cabin in Michigan with the intention of fixing it up for his daughter. Instead, the bank tried to foreclose on the property and the locks were changed, court records show.
articles.byline: By Andrew Martin and Motoko Rich

articles.headline: Tax Shortfalls Spur New Fear on Europe’s Recovery Bid
articles.snippet: With falling tax revenues and high deficits, European nations now face the prospect that they will miss budget targets forced upon them this year by impatient bond investors.
articles.abstract: With falling tax revenues and high deficits, European nations now face the prospect that they will miss budget targets forced upon them this year by impatient bond investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON  The mathematics of austerity are getting harder.

articles.headline: In Spain, Homes Are Taken but Debt Stays
articles.snippet: Laws in Spain are saddling some homeowners with mountains of inescapable debt as the economy falters.
articles.abstract: Laws in Spain are saddling some homeowners with mountains of inescapable debt as the economy falters.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADRID — Manolo Marbán, 59, is still living in his house in Toledo and going to work in the small pink-and-aqua pet grooming shop he bought here in 2006, when he got swept up in Spain’s giddy real estate boom.

articles.headline: Treasury Links Foreclosure Ills to Lower Housing Prices
articles.snippet: The uncertainty over the legal status of foreclosed homes could further delay the recovery of the housing market, the Obama administration said.
articles.abstract: The uncertainty over the legal status of foreclosed homes could further delay the recovery of the housing market, the Obama administration said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The uncertainty over the legal status of foreclosed homes in the nation could further depress home prices and delay the recovery of the housing market, the Obama administration said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: In Icy Tip of Afghanistan, War Seems Remote
articles.snippet: The rules that apply to the rest of Afghanistan are often irrelevant in the Wakhan Corridor.
articles.abstract: The rules that apply to the rest of Afghanistan are often irrelevant in the Wakhan Corridor.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOZAI GUMBAZ, Afghanistan — As the pickup truck bounced toward a remote village deep in northeastern Afghanistan, the young woman was told by her companions that she could toss her burqa aside.

articles.headline: Stores Push Black Friday Into October
articles.snippet: The shopping event is arriving ahead of Halloween this year with some promotions beginning this week.
articles.abstract: The shopping event is arriving ahead of Halloween this year with some promotions beginning this week.
articles.lead_paragraph: Attention bargain shoppers! It is October  and Black Friday specials are here.

articles.headline: China Wrests Supercomputer Title From U.S.
articles.snippet: Tianhe-1A has 1.4 times the horsepower of the current top computer, which is at a laboratory in Tennessee.
articles.abstract: Tianhe-1A has 1.4 times the horsepower of the current top computer, which is at a laboratory in Tennessee.
articles.lead_paragraph: A Chinese scientific research center has built the fastest supercomputer ever made, replacing the United States as maker of the swiftest machine, and giving China bragging rights as a technology superpower.
